meanings.definition: To strike or propel with the foot.
meanings.sent1: She was kicking the ball with all her might.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys kicking the soccer ball during practice.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was kicking his legs in excitement.
meanings.sent4: The horse was kicking up dust as it ran across the field.
meanings.sent5: The dancer was kicking her legs gracefully in the air.

meanings.sent1: The child was kicking and screaming in the store.
meanings.sent2: She was kicking against the unfair decision made by the committee.
meanings.sent3: The cat was kicking at the closed door, wanting to go outside.
meanings.sent4: The waves were kicking against the rocks, creating a loud sound.
meanings.sent5: He was kicking himself for missing the important meeting.

meanings.sent1: The kicking of the engine signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent2: His kicking against the door finally broke it open.
meanings.sent3: The kicking of the waves against the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent4: The audience could feel the kicking of the drums in their chests.
meanings.sent5: The kicking of the horse's hooves echoed through the valley.
